    • Method Detail

      • CopyFile

        public static boolean CopyFile(File in,
               File out)
                        throws IOException
        Copy a file from one place to another, retaining permisions.

        This calls an external copy program on the operating system to make sure it is properly copied and permissions are retained.

        It is strongly advised to make sure the destination file does not exist already.

        Returns:
        true if file was copied, false if no files was copied
        Throws:
        IOException - on error, as far as it can be detected from the utilities

      • listFilesOnly

        public static File[] listFilesOnly(File path)
        List ordinary files in a directory.

        Parameters:
        path - Directory to list files in
        See Also:
        File.listFiles()

      • CopyFiles

        public static void CopyFiles(File[] fromFiles,
             File toPath)
                      throws IOException
        Copies a list of files to a directory.

        When an error occurs, files already copied are removed again and an IOException is thrown.

        It is discouraged to have files with the same name existing already in the destination path.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • MoveFiles

        public static void MoveFiles(File[] fromFiles,
             File toPath)
                      throws IOException
        Moves a list of files to a directory.

        When an error occurs, files already moved are put back and an IOException is thrown.

        It is discouraged to have files with the same name existing already in the destination path.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • recursiveDelete

        public static void recursiveDelete(File what)
        Helper method: remove directory recursively.

        Beware, symlinks might traverse into unwanted territory!

      • EachFile

        protected static void EachFile(File[] fromFiles,
            FileUtils.FileCallback callback)
                        throws IOException
        Runs a callback on each file specified.

        Implements a rollback mechanism: when the callback throws an IOException, the previous operations are undone by means of the FileUtils.FileCallback.reverseAction(java.io.File) method.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • readFile

        public static String readFile(File file)
                       throws IOException
        Return the contents of a text file as String
        Throws:

             String data)
                      throws IOException
        Write a String to a text file, possibly overwriting it.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • chmod

        public static boolean chmod(File file,
            boolean read,
            boolean write,
            boolean exec,
            boolean ownerOnly)
        Change file permissions

        Not supported natively until java 1.6. Bad Java. Note that the ownerOnly argument differs from Java. When ownerOnly is true for Java's File.setReadable(boolean, boolean), File.setWritable(boolean, boolean) or File.setExecutable(), the other/group permissions are left as they are. This method resets them instead. When ownerOnly is false, behaviour is as Java's.

        Parameters:
        file - File to set permissions on
        read - if reading should be allowed
        write - if writing should be allowed
        exec - if executing should be allowed
        ownerOnly - true to set group&world permissions to none, false to set them all alike

      • createTempDir

        public static File createTempDir(String prefix,
                 File directory)
                          throws IOException
        Create a temporary directory with read-only permissions.

        TODO Current code contains a race-condition. Please see Sun bug 4735419 for a better solution.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • Exec

        public static int Exec(String[] cmd,
       String input,
       StringBuffer output)
                throws IOException
        Execute a command, enter input on stdin, and return the exit code while storing stdout and stderr.

        The process must stop waiting for input by itself, and not rely on its stdin being closed. This doesn't work on Windows, so the process will never terminate.

        Parameters:
        cmd - command to run
        input - String to feed to process's stdin
        output - String to which stdout and stderr is appended, or null
        Returns:
        process exit code
        Throws:
        IOException

      • Exec

        public static int Exec(String[] cmd)
                throws IOException
        Execute a command and return the exit code
        Throws:
        IOException
